Trip reports and media

Background

Much of the upper part of this canyon, above the first waterfall, is on private land. You could be subject to trespassing charges if you go here. This canyon has a long and bumpy history with access, after the city attempted to rebuild the Horsethief Trail on private land without consulting the owner. He closed the trail but access was restored to the lower reaches, the Pool Wall, where all of the rock climbs are. The upper sections are owned by a different entity. Come here at your own risk.
name: Skyrocket Creek
